summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons policy manual detailing the elements and definitions of prohibited acts for inmates, categorized by severity (Greatest, High, Moderate, Low Moderate). It outlines the legal framework for charging inmates with disciplinary offenses, including elements required for proof such as subject, time, location, act, and victim.
keyFacts: The document is a Bureau of Prisons policy manual effective November 18, 2020, defining prohibited acts for inmates.
It categorizes offenses by severity level (Greatest: 100-series, High: 200-series, Moderate: 300-series, Low Moderate: 400-series).
Key elements required to prove a prohibited act include: Subject (inmate), Time, Location, Act, and Victim (where applicable).
Specific prohibited acts defined include killing (100), assault (101, 224), sexual assault (114, 229), escape (102, 200), and introduction/possession of contraband (104, 108, 111, 113).
The document provides legal definitions for each offense code, establishing the framework for inmate discipline within the federal prison system.
